title: thunderbird question: removing Imap from global Inbox?
content:
First post. I was trying to target a Thunderbird forum but I get vectored to Mozilla which seems to be more focused on Firefox. Sorry if I'm in the wrong place.

First, it was my impression that a global Inbox could be POP accts only. But my global Inbox has a POP acct and an IMAP account. I'm not sure but this might have happened when I converted one of my POP accts to IMAP. Am I wrong about this theory? Going forward, I'm going to refer to this IMAP acct as the "bad" one.

As a result, my bad IMAP acct that appears in the global Inbox has no Inbox of its own under its account. What I'm looking to do is get the bad IMAP Inbox out of the global Inbox and back into its account in my sidebar.

There's nothing wrong with my e-mail but I want to keep it that way. I have another IMAP account (aka "good") and as a result of my situation, I have to look at the bad Inbox and the good Inbox of the two IMAP accounts in different ways in the interface and it annoys me.

I've looked at the account settings. The good IMAP acct has the personal namespace "INBOX." whereas the bad IMAP acct has the personal namespace "". I've tried changing the bad personal namespace to "INBOX." as well but I also have "allow server to override these namespaces" and it won't stick. I don't understand IMAP well enough to be confident about making more changes without getting advice.

Hope this isn't too confusing.
creator: jeglin

title: how to migrate my email from one Gmail account to another GMail account, specifying a date range
content:
Hello Forum!

My GMail account is approaching the 15GB limit and so I will need to migrate my email from one Gmail account to another, specifying a date range. range (i.e., any email sent before June 2015). Can Thunderbird help me to do that? If so, what is the process I need to go through?

Thanks in advance to all who reply, Dan

content:
I have a Google Calendar, in which I manage My Tasks. I can't see my existing tasks in Thunderbird, and I can't add new tasks to the Google Calendar. New Task in Thunderbird is greyed out and the field next to it has the writing: "Please select a calendar that supports tasks".

creator: mf10

title: Cartelle in appdata/roaming occupano spazio enorme
content: Buongiorno a tutti, ho un grosso problema di spazio. Continuo a liberare spazio sul mio disco C che il giorno dopo trovo di nuovo quasi pieno e andando a cercare dove poteva essere il problema ho trovato che la dir di Thunderbird in AppData\Roaming occupa circa 200 gb! Da quello che ho visto mi ritrovo con i file .eml della stessa email moltiplicati anche fino a quasi 200 volte :( Ad esempio il file VI1P190MB00620AEFD3F00D0EC55AC2E1C2D2A@VI1P190MB0062.EURP190.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM-197.eml è copiato 197 volte. Quindi la directory dove è archiviata questa email, che sul programma mi dice essere costituita da 1132 email per 1,3 gb di spazio, in realtà sul disco è costituita da 79276 files ed occupa 106 gb di spazio. C'è qualcosa che posso controllare a livello di impostazioni per evitare il moltiplicarsi dei file?
creator: giorgini.alex

title: Erro recente no Windows11
content: Ao tentar digitar emails, procurar mensagens entre outras tarefas no Thunderbird o windows 11 apresenta uma mensagem: Este aplicativo fez uma conexão não segura que foi relatada à Microsoft por roubar senhas. A Microsoft recomenda alterar a senha da sua conta local do Windows para manter seu dispositivo seguro. Já tentei trocar a senha do windows, mas volta a aparecer, há alguma forma de eu colocar esse aplicativo como confiável para que não apareça mais essa mensagem?

title: After 1-2 days of use Mozilla Thunderbird just hangs and can not be even restarted...
content: Hi, for some time now (around a month), after a couple of days using Thunderbird, I can not load new messages, can not send new messages, and it basically is nonfunctional. The blue bar down right shows an active process that never ends (for example, "sending message"). All menus and software as a whole are still operating, and there is no crash on hang, but every attempt to load my emails or send data ends with endless waiting (no errors whatsoever). When I try to exit the application, it closes down, but a process is listed in Task Manager. When I kill the process manually and try to start the software again, nothing starts (a new process appears in the task manager), but the software never opens a window or something. Only a full computer restart helps, and everything works again for 1-2 days. I have disabled all extensions and tried even troubleshoot mode. No crash reports...

creator: dmatusow

title: Problém s přijímáním i odesíláním zpráv  od posledních 2 aktualizací po určitém čase od spuštění
content: Ahoj, Thunderbird mám puštěný prakticky celý den. Mám v něm několik účtů. Od posledních 2 aktualizací se pravidelně po určité době, kdy Thunderbird běží stahování (pomocí IMAP) i odesílání zpráv "zasekne": Po spuštění ráno se zprávy stahují i odesílají a po nějaké delší době (např. po několika hodinách) se stahovat i odesílat přestanou a aplikace hlásí, že nebylo možné se k účtu přihlásit. Přitom přes webové rozhraní se k emailům dostanu a vidím, že na serveru jsou nové zprávy, které se ale do aplikace od určitého času nedají stáhnout a pokus o odeslání končí chybou pro nemožnost se k serveru připojit. Nepomůže restart aplikace. Samotní poskytovatelé emailové služby mají server i přístup funkční - ověřoval jsem telefonicky. Obvykle musím restartovat PC - a po té se Thunderbird (verze 115.11.0 64-bit) opět na nějaký čas rozběhne a pracuje standardně. Pomůže někdo? Honza
creator: honza.brhel

title: Thunderbird 115.10.1 (64-bit) fails to send SMTP messages
content:
Since Thunderbird was upgraded to 115.10.1 (64-bit), it now fails to send SMTP messages with the following error.

Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) ***.mail.pairserver.com was lost in the middle of the transaction. Try again.

This affects all six(6) accounts in Thunderbird, all of them can receive and edit e-mail messages; however, all of them fail to send e-mail messages.

Prior versions of Thunderbird have worked with this configuration for many years.

Other e-mail clients such as Evolution do not have this issue and I have confirmed with my provider that Thunderbird is no longer sending e-mails.

Any thoughts on how to roll back Thunderbird until this issue is resolved?
creator: mozilla414

title: Emails gone after running "repair folder"
content:
My wife is an ardent and long-time Thunderbird user. She has tens of thousands of old emails organized into dozens of folders. Recently she noted that many folders contained scrambled emails. For example, an email titled "The race to re-design sugar" from Sept. 2020 now contained what looked like content from an email from Office Depot. See below for a short piece of the body of the email. Anyway, I ran Thunderbird's "repair folder" function and not only did it not unscramble the emails, it also seems to have deleted any emails prior to 6 months ago. Fortunately I've got her T-Bird profile file backed up daily, so was able to restore the original (but scrambled) emails. Any thoughts? I use outlook, but I've got pretty good PC skills if you need to take me into the weeds. Thanks!

Example of one of the scrambled emails: 'From - Sun Feb 4 12:28:28 2024 X-Account-Key: account5 X-UIDL: AEZHkUhl+QCXZb/zNgpcWOY28vQ X-Mozilla-Status: 0009 X-Mozilla-Status2: 00000000 X-Mozilla-Keys: Received: from 127.0.0.1 by atlas-sbc-production.v2-mail-prod1-bf1.omega.yahoo.com pod-id atlas--sbc-production-bf1-7448fd4479-zt82t.bf1.yahoo.com with HTTP; Sun, 4 Feb 2024 20:27:34 +0000 Return-Path: <error@em.officedepot.com> X-Originating-Ip: [20.57.66.208] Received-SPF: pass (domain of em.officedepot.com designates 20.57.66.208 as permitted sender) Authentication-Results: atlas-sbc-production.v2-mail-prod1-bf1.omega.yahoo.com; dkim=pass header.i=@em.officedepot.com header.s=officedepot; spf=pass smtp.mailfrom=em.officedepot.com; dmarc=pass(p=NONE) header.from=em.officedepot.com; X-Apparently-To: xxxx.xxxx@att.net; Sun, 4 Feb 2024 20:27:34 +0000 X-YMailISG: T.w7qP0WLDtIndBfVsii11yVLG9YUwuh8bXrpNWGHf2Ezt9n W35tfL8ReGJq0phUGg1KeSNel41YbOoogg21rDC6q0i7xvo0jIbdikP0kWCS '

title: MUDEI NOME DA PASTA LOCAL MINHAS COISAS MIGROU NOVA PASTA MAS NÃO CONSIGO MAIS USAR
content:
Olá.

Minha pasta local no Thunderbirt era essa abaixo: (1º pasta). mailbox:///C:/Users/FRAN/AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles/c95torrf.default-release/Mail/Local Folders/RECEBIDOS

Então altereio diretório local para outra pasta, essa abaixo: (2º pasta).

C:\Users\FRAN\Documents\ARQUIVOS SERVIDOR 16.07.23\EMAILS ARQUIVADOS\ARQUIVOS

Pediu para reiniciar, e quando voltou tudo da 1º pasta não existia mais, então fui na pasta e vi que criou arquivos dentro dela, a pasta nova, contudo preciso voltar agora o diretório para a 1º pasta, mas não estou conseguindo.

Não consigo achar onde está a 1º pasta.

Podem me ajudar com informações mais populares e menos técnicas por gentileza!

Muito obrigado!

Sds, Francisco Sampaio
creator: f.fsampaio30

"Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <MattMcKeegan_PLS@proton.me>... Relaying denied: You must check for new mail before sending mail.. Please check the message recipient "MattMcKeegan_PLS@proton.me" and try again."

title: Problems creating or renaming folders
content:
I've been reorganizing my folders, and while working on this, I will occasionally find that I can no longer create a new folder or rename an existing one, or, somewhat worse, when I rename a folder, it will disappear, along with the messages that were in it. The messages that were in the missing folder don't show up in a search, and aren't in trash.

If I close Tbird and quickfilters, and sometimes also restart the computer, the functions again work as they should (but the missing folders do not reappear). Rebuilding the parent folder doesn't recover the missing subfolder. The problem can happen when Tbird is the only open application.

Any idea what can cause this? Or where the missing emails might be?

Thanks Kent
creator: kentmurray
